results.title: The Rumour of true things
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Most of the moving images produced for science, industry, commerce and medicine are seen only by specialised audiences and are then discarded soon after they are made.

The Rumour of True Things’ is constructed entirely from such moving images ephemera, including computer games, weapons testing, production lines, monitoring and marriage agency tapes.The Rumour of True Things’ is a remarkable anthropological portrait of a technologically-based society obsessed with imaging itself.

Taken from PROOF exhibition November 2004

results.title: The Living Cell
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: The Role of the cell membrane

results.title: What are cells?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Living Cell”.
To introduce this film the concept of cellular organization of plants and animals is examined and the main parts of a cell are identified. The diversity of cells within a single organism is illustrated. A brief history of microscopy shows how improvements in instrument made possible the formulation of the cell theory. An animated sequence demonstrates the process of mitotic nuclear division in an animal cell and the film end s by showing the major differences between plant and animals cells.

group_siblings.title: The Role of the cell membrane

results.title: The Role of the cell membrane
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Cell”.
Uses close-up photomicrography of a series of amoeba to show the structure and role of the cell membrane, or plasmalemma, as it pertains to “phagocytosis” and “pinocytosis”. Also shows an experiment investigating active transport of sodium ions across live frog skin and discusses possible mechanism for this behaviour. No other credits available.

results.title: The Rock of love = Sakhrat al hub
results.creator_credit: Rida Myassar and Egyptian Film Company
results.brief_description: Karima and Aadel are both escaping painful pasts and guarded secrets in Egypt. They meet in Beirut, a city where they find peace and where they fall in love. But as always, the road to love is a thorny one and they must both come to terms with their fears. For Karima, it is being stalked - is it the detective who is constantly turning up wherever she goes, or some other darker stranger? And Aadel must come to terms with his fears after a loveless marriage which ended in him brutally murdering his wife - for which he was imprisoned for one year! Starring Samira Ahmad and Aamad Homdy. In Arabic with no English subtitles.

results.title: The Robin
results.creator_credit: Donald Eastman, Rosemary Eastman and Gateway Educational Films
results.brief_description: A study of the robin and its relationship with man. Courtship behaviour, nest building and the rearing of young are shown in detail and the differences between migratory and non-migratory birds is explained.

results.title: The Road back
results.creator_credit: Luton and Dunstable Hospital and Vauxhall Motors
results.brief_description: The rehabilitation of injured employees at a large industrial organisation. The emphasis is on the severe injuries or illnesses which threaten chronic disablement and unemployment. How this can be greatly relieved or overcome by planned remedial work, with specially adapted machines and appliances under specialist medical supervision.

results.title: The River Rhone in Switzerland
results.brief_description: This film follows the Rhone River in its course through Switzerland. Farms, villages, cities and topography are viewed from land and air in a survey of the different kinds of life along the river.
